line_1: "Me to some churl in bargain he'll consign,
line_2: " And make some tyrant of the parish mine:

line_1: To him the church, the realm, their pow'rs consign,
line_2: Thro' him the rays of regal bounty shine,

line_1: As offerings to thee I'll consign,
line_2: Shall constant be serv'd at thy shrine.

line_1: To long posterity his praise consign,
line_2: And pay a life of hardships by a line.

line_1: To thee, a parent, sister, I consign,
line_2: Still may thy year in fullest splendor shine!

line_1: Call I command, can I consign?
line_2: Alas, what earthly thing is mine!

line_1: To foreign hands the smiling babe consign?
line_2: To foreign hands, alas! can you resign

line_1: To thee her months their richest gifts consign;
line_2: Her music, colours, odours, all are thine,
On dogs, or cards, or wine.
'And what our Patron yours and mine

line_1: The Drops to thee, Brillante, we consign;
line_2: And Momentilla, let the Watch be thine;
